problem.markdown:
1. Dry density of soil can be defined as the ratio of (x) Weight of solids to total volume () Weight of soil to the total volume of solids () Unit weight of the soil to the unit weight of water () None
2) The bulk density of coarse grained soils can be determined by (x) Sand replacement method () Core cutter method () Pycnometer method () Torsion balance method
3) The bulk density of clays can be determined by (x) Core cutter method () Pycnometer method () Torsion balance method () Sand replacement method
4) Unit weight of solids depends on (x) Compaction () Consolidation () Specific gravity () Void ratio
5) Bulk density, saturation density and dry density of soil varies upon () Degree of compaction () Degree of consolidation () Water content (x) Porosity
6) Different soils have different unit weights (x) True () False () Cannot be answered () Could not be answered
7) Select the correct one (x) Unit weight of dry soil is greater than unit weight of wet soil () For dry soils, dry unit weight is less than total unit weight () Unit weight of soil increases due to submergence in water () Unit weight of soil decreases due to submergence in water
problem.p: 1. Dry density of soil can be defined as the ratio of

choicegroup.choice: Weight of solids to total volume
Weight of soil to the total volume of solids
Unit weight of the soil to the unit weight of water

5) Bulk density, saturation density and dry density of soil varies upon
6) Different soils have different unit weights

For dry soils, dry unit weight is less than total unit weight
